passage_text: Best Answer: How long do I cook a precooked ham? It is 15 lbs. A precooked ham does not have to be cooked, but will taste better if you heat it thoroughly to an internal temperature of 140°F (60°C) or so. Place the ham in a 325°F oven (163°C). It will take 12 to 15 minutes per pound for a whole or boneless ham and 18 to 20 minutes per pound for a half ham.

1 Bake at 325°F for 18-20 minutes per pound, until a meat thermometer registers 140°F. 2  Unwrap the ham and apply the glaze; increase the heat to 400°F and bake for 15-20 minutes longer until the glaze is burnished. 1 The best way to do this is to place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan. 2  Add water to the bottom of the pan and cover the whole thing tightly with foil. 3  Bake at 325°F for 18-20 minutes per pound, until a meat thermometer registers 140°F.

1 If you want to glaze the ham, place on a broiler pan and cover with glaze; broil 10 from the heat for 10-15 minutes, watching carefully, until glaze is cooked. 2  Oven Method. 3  The goal is to reheat the ham without drying it out. 4  The best way to do this is to place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan. 1 The best way to do this is to place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan. 2  Add water to the bottom of the pan and cover the whole thing tightly with foil. 3  Bake at 325°F for 18-20 minutes per pound, until a meat thermometer registers 140°F.

1 Preheat the oven to 350°F. 2  If the ham is labeled 'fully cooked' (does not require heating), heat for 8 to 10 minutes per pound, or to an internal temperature of 140°F. 3  If the ham is labeled 'cook before eating,' heat to an internal temperature of 160°F. It is 15 lbs. A precooked ham does not have to be cooked, but will taste better if you heat it thoroughly to an internal temperature of 140°F (60°C) or so. Place the ham in a 325°F oven (163°C). It will take 12 to 15 minutes per pound for a whole or boneless ham and 18 to 20 minutes per pound for a half ham. You should also let it rest for 20 minutes or so out of the oven before you serve it.

1 Bake in a preheated 325°F oven for 10-14 minutes per pound, or until a meat thermometer registers 140°F. Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes before serving. 2  If the ham came with extra glaze, follow the package directions for adding it and cooking the glaze. 1 The best way to do this is to place the ham on a rack in a roasting pan. 2  Add water to the bottom of the pan and cover the whole thing tightly with foil. 3  Bake at 325°F for 18-20 minutes per pound, until a meat thermometer registers 140°F.
